name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

key_work.title: Analects of Kung Phu: Book 1, The 69 Dialogues between the Lamp and the Shadow
key_work.credit_line:
Jason Phu
Three-channel video installation, 85 mins.
Edited by Conor Bateman
Mordant Family Moving Image Commission, ACMI Collection
key_work.material_description: Three-channel digital video, colour and sound
key_work.brief_description: During times of uncertainty, people look for guidance. Jason Phu found it in martial arts films. By reclaiming wise sayings from movies and TV shows Analects of Kung Phu presents a moving image philosophy for surviving contemporary life.

constellations_primary.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_primary.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: Human rhythm
constellations_other.description: Presence is human form in digital motion. Creating from motion capture of real dancers, it’s the starting point in this Constellation exploring robots and digital choreography.

start.title: Drunken Master
start.creator_credit: Yuen Woo-Ping, Zhang Quan and Seasonal Film Corporation
start.brief_description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

end.title: Street Fighter X Tekken
end.brief_description: The long awaited dream match-up between the two titans of fighting is here!

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

links.description: Drunken Master didn’t just spawn a slew of imitators, including The Shaolin Drunken Monk (also in Analects of Kung Phu), but also videogames. The Tekken character Lei Wu Long uses the “Drunken Fist” style from Drunken Master in Street Fight X Tekken.

start.title: Street Fighter X Tekken
start.brief_description: The long awaited dream match-up between the two titans of fighting is here!

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

end.title: Police Story 3: Super Cop
end.creator_credit: Stanley Tong, Raymond Chow, Golden Harvest, Golden Way and Leonard Ho
end.brief_description: Jackie Chan is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

links.description: Over the Tekken series, Lei Wu Long used a bunch of Jackie Chan’s stances from films, beginning with the Snake style used in Yuen Woo-ping’s Snake in the Eagles Shadow, but Lei Wu Long is a Hong Kong cop based on Chan’s Police Story films.

start.title: Police Story 3: Super Cop
start.creator_credit: Stanley Tong, Raymond Chow, Golden Harvest, Golden Way and Leonard Ho
start.brief_description: Jackie Chan is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

end.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
end.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Columbia Pictures, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Sony Pictures and Zoom Hunt International
end.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

links.description: While filming Hong Kong action films, Michelle Yeoh realised martial arts was choreographed like dance, which she’d studied. She was soon doing her own stunts, including an iconic motorbike jump in Supercop 3 before later starring in films like Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon.

start.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
start.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Columbia Pictures, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Sony Pictures and Zoom Hunt International
start.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

Jason Phu
Three-channel video installation, 85 mins.
Edited by Conor Bateman
Mordant Family Moving Image Commission, ACMI Collection

end.brief_description: During times of uncertainty, people look for guidance. Jason Phu found it in martial arts films. By reclaiming wise sayings from movies and TV shows Analects of Kung Phu presents a moving image philosophy for surviving contemporary life.

constellations_primary.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_primary.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: Human rhythm
constellations_other.description: Presence is human form in digital motion. Creating from motion capture of real dancers, it’s the starting point in this Constellation exploring robots and digital choreography.

links.description: “Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon” is an idiom from Chinese poet Yu Xin, which is believed to mean a place or situation full of hidden masters, or an expression about the emotions and passion beneath polite society. The film also features in Analects of Kung Phu.

start.title: Drunken Master
start.creator_credit: Yuen Woo-Ping, Zhang Quan and Seasonal Film Corporation
start.brief_description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

end.title: Sinnui yauman (A Chinese Ghost Story)
end.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Cinema City Co, Film Workshop
end.brief_description: Leslie Cheung stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

links.description: Almost a decade after Drunken Master combined comedy with wuxia action, A Chinese Ghost Story added horror to the mix. Like many films featured in Phu’s work, it’s inspired by classical Chinese stories, in this case Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio.

start.title: Analects of Kung Phu: Book 1, The 69 Dialogues between the Lamp and the Shadow
start.credit_line:
Jason Phu
Three-channel video installation, 85 mins.

end.title: Drunken Master
end.creator_credit: Yuen Woo-Ping, Zhang Quan and Seasonal Film Corporation
end.brief_description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

links.description: One of the film’s Jason Phu has remixed into Analects of Kung Phu is Yuen Woo-ping’s 1978 Hong Kong action-comedy martial arts film Drunken Master, starring Jackie Chan as Wong Fei-hung, who learns the drunken fighting style of Beggar So.

start.title: Sinnui yauman (A Chinese Ghost Story)
start.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Cinema City Co, Film Workshop
start.brief_description: Leslie Cheung stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

end.title: Mr. Vampire
end.creator_credit: Ricky Lau, Mun-kai Ko, Sammo Hung, Bo Ho Film Company Ltd., Golden Harvest Company Ltd., Toho-Towa, Lam Sai-Kan, Sze-To Cheuk-Hon, Wong Ying and Barry Wong
end.brief_description: The planned reburial of a village elder goes awry as the corpse resurrects into a hopping, bloodthirsty vampire, threatening mankind. Therefore, a Taoist Priest and his two disciples attempt to stop the terror.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

links.description: Two years earlier, comedy and horror were combined in Mr. Vampire, a cult-classic based on the jiangshi, a hopping corpse that features in Chinese folklore. Like the ‘drunken master’ genre, it inspired a range of imitators and established a genre.

start.title: Mr. Vampire
start.creator_credit: Ricky Lau, Mun-kai Ko, Sammo Hung, Bo Ho Film Company Ltd., Golden Harvest Company Ltd., Toho-Towa, Lam Sai-Kan, Sze-To Cheuk-Hon, Wong Ying and Barry Wong
start.brief_description: The planned reburial of a village elder goes awry as the corpse resurrects into a hopping, bloodthirsty vampire, threatening mankind. Therefore, a Taoist Priest and his two disciples attempt to stop the terror.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

end.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
end.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Columbia Pictures, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Sony Pictures and Zoom Hunt International
end.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

links.description: Mr. Vampire was produced by Sammo Hung, a director, actor, choreographer and martial artist, who directed Michelle Yeoh in her first film, The Owl vs Bombo, where she appeared as a damsel in distress before Hung inspired her to learn martial arts.

start.title: Stunt superstar
start.last_on_display_place: Australian Centre for the Moving Image
start.brief_description: In the middle of a fierce fight in Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, Jen Yu (Zhang Ziyi) taunts Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) for being a “sore loser”. But Yu Shu has the experience to best her younger opponent in a scene that melds martial arts with the poetry of Chinese theatre.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

end.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
end.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Columbia Pictures, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Sony Pictures and Zoom Hunt International
end.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

links.description: The costumes that Michelle Yeoh wears in the iconic showdown with Ziyi Zhang in Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon is displayed in the ‘Stunt superstar’ display in Goddess. The film took home four Oscars. in 2023, Yeoh was the first Asian actor to win the Best Actress.
